alert.note: Alert for Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 12:51AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Colleton. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 AM EDT, Colleton County Emergency Management reported flooding along Ireland Creek in Walterboro. - Flooding continues along Ireland Creek in Walterboro following heavy rainfall that occurred Wednesday evening. Portions of Ireland Creek Drive, Ivanhoe Road, Forest Hills Drive, and Sweat Street remain closed. Water continues to surround several homes and businesses situated along Ireland Creek as well. Observations from a USGS river gauge located on the Highway 15 bridge indicate that the creek has crested and water levels are falling. Flood waters are expected to continue to fall through the night and flooding should come to an end Friday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
